thread.title: Team efforts send area schools to cross country regionals
thread.title_full: Team efforts send area schools to cross country regionals

author: Independent staff report
title: Team efforts send area schools to cross country regionals
text: Team efforts send area schools to cross country regionals Jackson, Perry, Tuslaw and Central Catholic all qualified both their boys and girls teams to the Boardman regional Comment Posted Oct. 26, 2015 at 12:14 AM By Independent staff report Posted Oct. 26, 2015 at 12:14 AM » RELATED CONTENT • PHOTO GALLERY: Cross Country District Tournament It was all about team as the high school cross country postseason got underway with district meets Saturday. Jackson, Perry, Tuslaw and Central Catholic all qualified both their boys and girls teams to the Boardman regional after finishing in the top four in their respective divisions at the district meet at Malone University. Dalton’s girls, meanwhile, finished second at the Medina district to qualify to the Tiffin regional. The Polar Bear girls captured the district championship as a team in the Division I race at Malone. They were led by Kayla Chapman’s district-title-winning race, followed by runner-up Greta Taylor. Michaela Huffman finished 13th, while Gigi Kinney took 17th to round out Jackson’s top four. The Jackson boys were second in the Division I boys race. Nate Mallue led the Polar Bears with a fifth-place finish, followed by Jaylon Grimes (sixth), Nick Huffman (10th) and Jared Marsh (12th). Perry’s boys were third in the Division I boys race. Cole Morris led the way with an eighth-place finish, followed by Johnny Stevenson in 13th, Daniel Cronk in 22nd and Joey Fedor in 28th. The Panther girls took fourth in the Division I girls race. Lexi Echelberry was the top finisher by taking ninth, while the rest of their top four featured Madelyn Bartolone (14th), Peyton Clark (16th) and Autumn Greco (22nd). In the Division II boys race, Tuslaw took second place. Chad Burrow paced the Mustangs with a fourth-place finish, followed by Zac Wilhelm in sixth, Jami Viront in seventh and Jacob Wenzel in ninth. Tuslaw’s girls were third in the Division II girls race. Bethany Koons was tops for the Mustangs — finishing 10th — while Rebecca George (12th), Alivia Tissot (19th) and Kay Dunlevy (20th) rounded out their top four. Central Catholic’s girls took second in the Division III girls race. Rachel Reolfi and Holly Miller finished third and fourth, respectively, while Megan Soehnlen (10th) and Maria Stump (16th) closed out the Crusader top four. Central Catholic’s boys took fourth in the Division III boys race. Alec Stalnaker finished 19th as the Crusaders’ best finish, followed by Matthew Mattis (22nd), Jon Reolfi (31st) and Nick Maio (35th). In the Division III district Medina, Dalton’s girls were second. Lily Baechle was the Bulldogs’ top finisher with a seventh-place finish, followed by Seneca Doty (16th), Aly Schiebe (17th) and Madee Kutz (19th). By Independent staff report
